metadata.key_specifications: Low voltage regulator diodes in hermetically sealed small SOD66 (DO-41) glass packages. Working voltage range: 3.3 V to 24 V. Total power dissipation: max. ≤ 1000 mW. Tolerance series: ±5%.
metadata.applications: The datasheet does not explicitly mention main applications for this series of regulator diodes.

page_summaries.content:
1.1 General description
Low voltage regulator diodes in hermetically sealed small SOD66 (DO-41) glass packages.
The series consists of 22 types with nominal working voltages from 3.3 to 24 V.

Limiting values — Stress above one or more limiting values (as deﬁned in the Absolute Maximum  Ratings System of IEC 60134) may  cause permanent damage  to the device. Limiting values are stress ratings only and operation of the device at these or any other conditions above those given in the Characteristics sections of this document is not implied. Exposure to limiting values for extended periods may affect device reliability.

Product Summary.content: Low voltage regulator diodes in hermetically sealed small SOD66 (DO-41) glass packages. The series consists of 22 types with nominal working voltages from 3.3 to 24 V.
Total power dissipation: max. ≤ 1000 mW. Tolerance series: ±5%. Working voltage range: nom. 3.3 V to 24 V. Small hermetically sealed glass package.

General description: Low voltage regulator diodes in hermetically sealed small SOD66 (DO-41) glass packages. The series consists of 22 types with nominal working voltages from 3.3 to 24 V. Features: Total power dissipation max. ≤ 1000 mW, Tolerance series ±5%, Working voltage range nom. 3.3 V to 24 V, Small hermetically sealed glass package.
Product profile overview: General description of low voltage regulator diodes, Key features including power dissipation, tolerance, voltage range, and package type.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 7 provides the electrical characteristics of the component, including the forward voltage (VF) at a forward current (IF) of 200 mA, which has a maximum value of 1.2 V.

Table 8 lists the characteristics for different types of the component, such as the working voltage (VZ), test current (Itest), differential resistance (rdif), reverse current (IR), working current (IZ), and non-repetitive peak reverse current (IZSM). The table provides the minimum, nominal, and maximum values for these parameters at different operating conditions, such as junction temperature (Tj).
Figure 2 shows a graph of the forward current as a function of the forward voltage, providing typical values for the component's current-voltage characteristics.

The electrical characteristics section covers important parameters related to voltage, current, power, and timing specifications, providing detailed information for different operating conditions and component types.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: Limiting values — Stress above one or more limiting values (as deﬁned in the Absolute Maximum Ratings System of IEC 60134) may cause permanent damage to the device.
Limiting values are stress ratings only and operation of the device at these or any other conditions above those given in the Characteristics sections of this document is not implied.
Exposure to limiting values for extended periods may affect device reliability.
